newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austria confirms two Creditanstalt offers.
newsitem.headline: Austria confirms two Creditanstalt offers.

text.p: The Austrian finance ministry on Monday confirmed radio reports that it had received two indicative offers for privatisation candidate Creditanstalt, the country's flagship bank.
"That's true," a ministry spokesman told Reuters. "Two indicative offers have been submitted."
Only one of the two potential bidders, a group around Austro-Italian insurer EA-Generali, is known. The ministry spokesman declined to identify the other party.
"We assured the second (bidder) of confidentiality," he said.
Interested parties will have to make binding offers for the government's 70 percent stake in Creditanstalt after the close of a two- to three-week due-diligence period, which was due to start today.

Indicative offers were based on a confidential study of the bank, conducted by JP Morgan for the Austrian government. More then 10 individuals had signed a confidentiality agreement and obtained a copy of the memorandum, the ministry official said.
